strIntroduction: This is a 2-hour tour around Ueno and Asakusa. The schedule of the tour is below: Meet at "Park Exit" of Ueno Station. 12:00 Walking through Ueno cultural district. You can see many museums, zoo and people relaxing there. 12:30 Passing on of the crowded shopping district in Tokyo, called Ameyoko. strIntroduction: This tour takes one day (about 6 hours). In the morning, we will meet at Misasa Onsen hot spring, located in the central area of Tottori prefecture. If you wish, I can pick you up at different places like JR Kurayoshi Station, Tottori Airport or Yonago Airport. First, we will visit Sanbutsuji Temple which is located on the foot of Mt. MItoku. This Tendai Buddhist temple has 1,300 years of history and you can try Zen meditation there if you like. Explore the trail of Mt. Mitoku for about one hour (one way). Along the trail you will find some old wooden buildings. There are some steep slopes where you will have to climb by holding chain ropes or roots of trees, but there is no danger, actually. When you reach the Nageire-do, a national treasure building, you will be completely fascinated. You might imagine the ancient people who built this holy and mysterious building. After returning, try a vegetarian lunch at one of the temple buildings. You can also enjoy an open-air hot spring. I can arrange this tour for 1-5 persons. This tour has also a 2-day version. The 2-day tour includes a stay at an old pilgrim's lodging in the precincts of the temple with 3 meals. We will meet at the JR Yonago Station or Yonago Airport in the afternoon. The tour ends in the 2nd day's afternoon at the station or the airport.
strTitle: Visit the unique mountain temple Mitoku Sanbutsuji, Tottori

strIntroduction: You can enjoy Tea Ceremony. We will explain about Sado (the way of tea) and you will then learn how to behave yourself as a guest by drinking and how to make Matcha (green tea). strTitle: Experience Tea ceremony in a Japanese style room in Nara

strIntroduction: There is nothing quite like exploring Japan by rail, and this relaxed Toreiyu Tsubasa train ride not only passes through some of Yamagata's most beautiful countryside, but this exciting new mode of Shinkansen travel does so in style, rather than at high speed. Toreiyu is a mix of Japanese imitated pronunciations for two words, the English word 'train' (torein) and the French word 'soleil' (soreiyu), meaning sun! JR East's Yamagata Shinkansen Tsubasa began operating in 1992 between Tokyo and Shinjo stopping at Fukushima and Yamagata along the way. Travel in style with reserved tatami mat seating in a carriage with spacious, elegantly designed interiors with large birchwood tables. Relax in a unique foot bath carriage before enjoying local Yamagata brewed sake, wines and juices at the Yuagari Lounge with its sakura wood tables, tatami seating and bar counter. The foot baths are situated on raised stone flooring and enclosed with louvred partitions allowing you to watch the scenery go by as you relax undisturbed. You will feel almost as though you are riding in a moving hot spar! This requires an additional ticket fee of 350 JPY with the train fee. Foot bath reservations are limited, so book early to avoid disappointment. 15 minutes are allotted per foot bath and only passengers with a designated time foot bath reservation are permitted into the foot bath area. Under some circumstances, foot bath tickets might be available on the train. This service is available only on Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays except 13 and 14 August.
strTitle: Enjoy Toreiyu Tsubasa Train ride from Fukushima to Yamagata!

strIntroduction: This is a train tour that takes you to Nagano and is located in the middle of Honshu taking 2 hours 20 minutes from Tokyo. Nagano is a mountainous landlocked prefecture in the center of Japan's main island of Honshu. With this experience you will take the Hokuriku Shinkansen to Nagano, then you will ride the Iiyama Scenic Train "Oykot," which is "Tokyo" spelled backwards. In Japanese, the name is written in hiragana as "Oikotto" (おいこっと). The train was designed around the concept of rustic Japan and bringing people to home villages, where the true heart of the Japanese people resides. Gazing at the rice paddies fading into the distance, passengers feel a sense of calm and healing. To help bring home the image of the home villages, with its scenic rice paddies, rivers and mountains this train is named "Oykot" because it is the total opposite to the modern City of Tokyo! This plan includes an overnight stay in Nozawa and meal tickets in Tookamachi. For Soba lovers this is a wonderful plan because you can get to eat Hegisoba which is a very famous noodle in Tookamachi. Itinerary : 1st day: -Tokyo (Ueno/Omiya/Kumagaya/Honjouwadeda/Takadaki) Hokuriku Shinkansen (Hakutaka/Asama) -Nagano. Iiyama Scenic Train Oykot (9:15 am) -Tookamachi. (11:48 am) -Lunch You can go and look around and have lunch with meal tickets. -Tookamachi (15:30 pm) by the Oykot -Lunch You can go look around and have a lunch with a meal tickets. -Tookamachi (15:30 pm) by the Oykot -Iiyama (17:03 pm) Stay at Nozawa Onsen Hotel 2nd day Iiyama -Nagano Hokuriku Shinkansen (Hakutaka/Asama) -Tokyo (Takasaki/Honjouwaseda/ Kumagaya/Omiya/Ueno)
strTitle: Ride Shinkansen and the Old-Fashioned Train Oykot in Nagano!

strIntroduction: This is a great value two-day, one-night trip that includes Shinkansen (bullet train) tickets to and from Tohoku. Enjoy the unique experience of ride the SL Ginga and relax with a one-night hotel stay including dinner and breakfast. The SL Ginga is a steam-hauled, restored C58 239 locomotive, which runs between Hanamaki station and Kamaishi station with 4 cars. It makes a one round trip in two days, making the one-way duration approximately 4.5 hours. The outer body of the SL Ginga is based on the famous story the "Night of the Milky Way Railway". The story is modeled on a locomotive which runs through Iwate, which is where the famous Kenji Miyazawa was born and raised. This train has been in operation since 1989 and has changed its name over the years. In 2013 the SL Ginga was renamed and restarted regular service operation in the Tohoku area. Inside the train there is an optical planetarium that shows breathtaking views of the galaxy that transport you to an extraordinary world. The unique interior enhances the atmosphere and makes you feel as if you are in the story of the "Night of the Milky Way Railway." Enjoy the creative world and the excellent view of Iwate! The accommodations are extremely comfortable and guests can enjoy a panoramic ocean view of the Sanriku Coast. The schedule is as follows: First Day - Breakfast Course (1 hour and 46 minutes) - Departure from Tokyo Station - Bound for Shinhanamaki Station via the Tohoku Shinkansen - 10:50 Departure on SL Ginga - 15:07 Arrive at Kamaishi Station Guests are responsible for getting to their hotel on their own. Second Day - Guests are responsible for getting back to Kamaishi Station on their own. - Take bus from Sakari Station to Kesennuma - Transfer to a local train bound for Ichinoseki Station - Depart from Ichinoseki Station - Arrive at Tokyo Station
strTitle: Get Tickets for 1-Night Hotel Stay & SL Ginga Train, Iwate!

strIntroduction: Atami is one of the most popular places for hot springs in Japan. About 45 minutes by train from Tokyo makes it very convenient for people to travel to on holiday and business. There are also many wonderful sightseeing spots such as Atami Castle, a beautiful herb and rose garden and many more! Atami Fufu is a hidden retreat nestled in the hills of Atami. Their aim is to provide you with an unforgettable stay where you can relax and enjoy yourself. From the moment you arrive, knowledgeable and friendly staff are readily available to help you with whatever you need. All 26 rooms have their own hot springs on the veranda. Each room has a different theme complemented by interior luxury furniture to ensure every guest has their own unique experience. Guests can select their personal style of dinner from a choice of three: dining in the room, dining at their modern Japanese-style restaurant at a private table or enjoying Teppanyaki where the food is cooked right in front of you! The cuisine is made from Atami's seasonal seafood and mountain produce mixed with a selection of over 300 drinks! There is no dress code for the dining experience, so you can even wear your Yukata (room wear at a Japanese inn) to the restaurant. Besides the hot springs in each hotel room, a big hot spring is also available. The outdoor hot springs will make you feel as if you've been transported to another world full of natural wonders. This package includes aesthetic treatment for 60 minutes for one person. At the spa, they use the famous cosmetic brand “Sisley” from Paris. The skilled staff will counsel you and help decide the special menu for you. You can choose either a body or facial treatment. Adding to the treatment, you will also be given a voucher for 3000 yen to buy cosmetics. Check in is at 15:00 and check-out time is at 12:00. You can spend a relaxing time in the morning with a late breakfast and morning bath.
strTitle: Reserve Hotel Room with Spa Treatment in Shizuoka

Your dining experience is made with local products and specialties, which have been harvested along the railway line. Explore and learn about the charm of Kumamoto and Kagoshima through your appreciation of the local cuisine. Along the way there will be several unique and exciting services. strTitle: Get Tickets for Orange Restaurant Train Tour in Kumamoto!

strIntroduction: Hakone Suishoen is a Ryokan style Luxury Japanese inn located in Kowakudani. All 23 have their own natural hot springs on the veranda. Each room has a different theme complemented by interior luxury furniture to ensure every guest has their own unique experience. Their master chef prepares tantalizing delicacies using carefully selected ingredients and served in the tranquil atmosphere of Hakone-Suishoen's namesake, Suishoen. It was built in 1925 and designated as tangible cultural properties. You can experience a true kaiseki course at your private table. There is no dress code for the dining experience, so you can even wear your Yukata (room wear at a Japanese inn) to the restaurant. You can also enjoy the sights, sounds and flavor of Teppanyaki at the lively Teppanyaki counter, where grilled delicacies are meticulously prepared before your very eyes. Teppanyaki, using only select meats, seafood and the freshest seasonal ingredients. There is an aesthetic bar beside the dining restaurant with a selection of wines and a seasonal drink menu. Besides the hot springs in each hotel room, a big hot spring is also available. The outdoor hot springs will make you feel as if you've been transported to another world full of natural wonders. This package includes esthetic treatment for 90 minutes for one person. At the spa, they use the famous cosmetic brand “Sisley”. The skilled staff will counsel you and help decide the special menu for you. Adding to the treatment, you will also be given a voucher for 5000 yen to buy cosmetics. If your partner would also like to get treated, the second person can get a 20% discount. It’s time to spoil yourself at the luxurious Japanese inn Hakone Suishoen! Check in is at 15:00 and check out is at 12:00.
strTitle: Book a Luxury Hotel with Spa Treatment in Kanagawa!

strIntroduction: The Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route connects Toyama city in Toyama prefecture with Omachi town in Nagano prefecture and is part of the Northern Japan Alps. It is traversed by different means of transportation including cablecars, trolley buses and a ropeway. It's popular for the magnificent scenery of the Tateyama Mountain Range, which is located within the Chubu Sangaku National Park. Among its most notable sights are the Kurobe Dam, the snow wall at Murodo, and the endless hiking and trekking trails for the more experienced mountaineers. In this package tour, you will depart from Takayama bus terminal at 7:40 and head towards Hirayu onsen (8:40), and then on to Ogizawa Station (11:10), where you will start your adventure on the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route. You will first hop on the Trolley bus that will take you through a tunnel to Kurobe Dam, the tallest dam in Japan standing at 186 m high, offering breathtaking views of the lake and the water discharge in summer. Then, you will then take a cable car up the hill to Kurobedaira, where you can visit a garden featuring high altitude plants. Next, hope on a ropeway to reach Daikanbo, where you will find an observation deck and be stunned by the amazing views of the Japan Alps. You will then ride a Trolley bus to Murodo, which depending on the season, will offer stunning views of the impressive snow wall that can reach up to 20 m high. Continue your journey down to Bijodaira by bus and then on to Tateyama by cablecar, then to Toyama Station by train, from which you will ride a bus back to Takayama bus terminal where the tour ends.
strTitle: Explore beautiful nature at Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route!

strIntroduction: Kurobe Dam is one of the largest dams in the world, and Japan's tallest dam, standing at 186 meter high. It was constructed between 1956 and 1963 at had a cost of 51.3 billion JPY. It is located in the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route, a popular mountain sightseeing route from the Omachi hot spring village in Nagano Prefecture to Tateyama, Toyama Prefecture. It has become a popular summer tourist attraction due to the spectacle of ten tons of water discharged per second that produces a mist cloud that can be seen from observation decks located at different spots of the dam. It's privileged location in Japan's so-called Northern Alps provides an easy access to breathtaking natural sights such as the Tateyama mountain range and forests, Kurobe lake, which can be explored on a 30 minute boat ride as well as trails and treks in and around the dam. Itinerary This package tour departs from Takayama bus terminal at 7:40 and takes you to Hirayu Onsen (8:40), and then on to Ogizawa station (11:10), where you will board the touristic Trolley bus to Kurobe Dam. You will have plenty of time to explore the dam and its surroundings. Be amazed by the stunning sight of the water discharge, trek along the dam, follow a trail in the forest or take a short boat ride. You will be free to explore the area at your leisure before taking the trolley back to Ogizawa station (16:05), and then on to Hirayu Onsen(18:35), before finally arriving back to Takayama bus terminal (19:35).
strTitle: Explore the breathtaking landscape of Kurobe Dam in Toyama

strIntroduction: This is package tour departing Takayama bus station that allows you to experience a rail mountain bike adventure. It consists of two mountain bicycles fixed on a metal frame than run along the tracks of an old railway. This is a very unique way to explore the local sights and beautiful natural landscapes of Gifu prefecture near Takayama city. Itinerary This tour includes an 80-minute bus ride from Takayama bus station that takes you to Kamioka Eigyosho bus stop, from where you will take a taxi to Gattan Go offices. There, you will receive a brief explanation on how to use the bike before setting off on your adventure. You will have an hour of riding along the tracks that stretch for 5.8 km starting at Okuhida Osenguchi station all the way to Kamioka Kozanmae station, where you will then turn back to the starting point. The route goes through exciting pitch black tunnels, an elevated bridge and stunning natural landscapes. If you have some time before or after riding the bike you will also be able to take a brake at either “Asunaro cafe” where a courtesy coffee is included or at “Gattan cafe” where you can enjoy a 5% discount on your order. After the activity is over, you will ride a taxi back to Kamioka Eigyosho and then on to the bus back to Takayama station. This package tour including bus ride, taxi fee and Gattan Go mountain rail bike experience fee is available in a morning tour departing from Takayama bus terminal at 9:40 and returning at 14.50 and an afternoon tour departing at 12:40 and returning at 17:20. Additionally, you can also take a mountain rail bike and Shinhotaka ropeway tour, which departs at 9:40 from Takayama station and follows the same itinerary as the morning tour, except, after the visit to Gattan Go, you'll take a bus to Shinhotaka ropeway, where you will ride a cable car that will take you to the top of the mountain for a breathtaking view of the area, before coming back to Takayama bus terminal at 18:31. Don't miss the chance to explore the astounding natural beauty and picturesque landscapes of Gifu prefecture in this unique way!
strTitle: Ride a unique bicycle on an old railway in Takayama, Gifu!

strIntroduction: This is a train tour that takes you to Inawashiro, Fukushima, and is located almost in the center of Fukushima prefecture in the Tohoku region on the island of Honshu. Start from the Kanto area by taking the Tohoku Shinkansen and get off at Kooriyama Station before taking the "Frutia Fukushima" which was created as a riding café to relax and enjoy looking at the passing scenery while enjoy natures delicious sweets, fresh fruits. You get off at Inawashiro Station where you can enjoy exploring one of Japan's premier tourist spots, offering visitors the opportunity to see nature in all its magnificence regardless of the season. Inawashiro is home to Japan's fourth biggest lake, Lake Inwashiro, one of the country's top one hundred mountains, Mt. Bandai, and the birthplace of Nobel Prize candidate Hideyo Noguchi. The Urabandai Royal Hotel is surrounded by a lush forest and is just minutes from Goshiki Onsen, the local hot springs, and around 10 minutes drive from Lake Inawashiro which is renowned for its resident swans during the winter. Included, is dinner and breakfast. Itinerary: 1st day Tokyo Station (Ueno/ Omiya/ Koyama/Utsunomiya) Tohoku Shinkansen -Kooriyama Station -Frutia Fukushima 1 (9:41 am) -Frutia Fukushima 3 (12:44 pm) -Inawashiro Station -Frutia Fukushima 1 (10:24 am) -Frutia Fukushima 3 (13:23 pm) -Urabandai Royal Hotel (Dinner and Breakfast) 2nd day Inwashiro Station, Ban'etsu West line -Kooriyama Station -Tohoku Shinkansen -Tokyo Station ( Utsunomiya/koyama/Omiya/Ueno) Optional detail: Low season: July, September High season: August
strTitle: Ride Frutia Train & Stay at Urabandai Royal Hotel Fukushima!

strIntroduction: Japan is home to hundreds of miles of sandy beaches, and its coastline hides reefs and river mouths, enticing many surfers to test the waves off the Land of the Rising Sun. Shonan is just an hour by train to the west of downtown Tokyo and is a magical place. Shonan isn't a city but instead the name of a collection of beaches and beautiful spots along the coast. The best part of Shonan is the long sandy beaches with rolling waves under the ever watchful eye of Mt. Fuji further ahead. Shonan Beach is often featured in TV shows, songs and movies and the “capital of surfing” in Japan has its own laidback atmosphere which is a mix of California, Hawaii and a Japanese fishing village. It is normal to see surfers riding bicycles with a surfboard attached checking the ocean, ready to jump in if the waves are rolling and if you stop by local stores in this area during summer, you will see surfers shopping with just swim trunks and flip flops. 8 Hotel Shonan Fujisawa is located just a 2 minute walk from Fujisawa Station and offers a surfing experience plan. If you want to experience surfing and feel Shonan’s comfortable breeze, there is no other choice but this plan. Experience time: 9:30 – 11:30 13:30 – 15:30 Non-smoking standard room for 2 people: * The rate includes accommodation for 2 people, surfing set, locker and shower. Note that you need to bring your own swimsuit and towel. The following conditions will apply: * After the reservation, 8 Hotel calls you for confirmation. If you cannot be contacted by 3 days before the reserved date, the reservation will be cancelled. * Surfing can only be experienced on your check-in day. * The surfing experience may be cancelled due to the weather or sea conditions. If the cancellation is determined on your check-in day, the experience fee will be refunded.
strTitle: Surf and Stay Near Tokyo in Shonan, Kanagawa!

strIntroduction: There is nothing quite like exploring Japan by rail, and the Tohoku Emotion train ride along the picturesque Sanriku coastline has a well-deserved reputation for its elegant concept. In addition to the exquisite interior design, integral art and panoramic views, the Tohoku Emotion is renowned for its cuisine. Carriage number 1 features seven compartment rooms decorated with Fukushima's traditional sashiko-ori wall fabric. Carriage number 2's open kitchen space is decorated with kogin sashi embroidery, a tradition of Aomori. Here you can watch your food being prepared as you wait. The stylish dining room in Carriage number 3 is beautifully finished with Aomori kogin-sashi embroidery, Iwate kohaku amber illumination, and Ogatsu inkstone from Miyagi. Enjoy a menu of local Tohoku ingredients while gazing at the sea off the Sanriku coast. Day 1 of your 2 day trip leaves from Tokyo Station via the Hayabusa Tohoku Shinkansen (standard reserved seat) to Hachinohe Station in Aomori. From here you will board the Tohoku Emotion, traveling along the coast all the way to Kuji Station. Here you will transfer to the Sanriku Tetsudo North Liase line to Miyako Station where guests will make their own way to the Jodogahama Park Hotel where they will stay (a shuttle service can be booked in advance). On the 2nd day, guests will make their own way to Morioka Station from where they will take the Tohoku Shinkansen back to Tokyo (standard reserved seat). 2-day trip with Tohoku Emotion ride, low season (July-September) 2-day trip with Tohoku Emotion ride, high season (August)
strTitle: Enjoy 2 Day Trip with Tohoku Emotion Train Ride from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Exploring Japan by rail is always a rewarding experience, and this one day event trip from Tokyo combines both the high speed comfort of the Shinkansen, with a fun-filled trip through scenic Niigata by local rail. Starting from either Tokyo, Ueno, Omiya, Kumagaya or Honjyo Waseda Stations you will travel on the Hokuriki Shinkansen to Joetsu Myoko Station. There you will board a reserved Koshino Shu Kura event train bound for Tokamachi. As the train winds its way along the beautifully scenic Niigata coastline, you will be able to sample some of Niigata's famous sake, brewed using the regions superior rice. There will also be live jazz or classical music performed on the train. The train will stop over at Umekawa station close to the sea coast and where you can feel the sea air. The Shu Kura event train terminates at Tokamachi Station, where you will have free time to explore, visit an onsen (hot spring bath) or have a meal at your own leisure. When you are ready to return to Tokyo, take the regular, non-reserved Hokuriku Kyuko train service to Echigo Yuzawa Station. From there, take the Joetsu Shinkansen back to Tokyo or the station you started from. Please note: the Koshino Shu Kura event train may take one of three slightly different, but equally scenic routes between Joetsu Myoko Station and Tokamachi Station depending on the day and the date of travel. The train service is available on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays only.
strTitle: Enjoy a One Day Train Trip on the Koshino Shu Kura, Niigata!

strIntroduction: Niki Ride is a unique wellness program where you can enjoy not only cycling on scenic Nasu roads with specialists but you can also relax with a massage and delicious meals. This is a rare opportunity to ride alongside pros from a road race team: “Nasu Blasen”. For cycling beginners, they will teach how to start road cycling on a cross bike and for experienced riders, they will train like professionals. The price includes a one-night stay at the stylish hotel "Niki Club," cross bike rental, and on-course mechanical and nutritional support. After biking, it will be time to relax your body and soul with a massage service and hot spa that will ease your sore muscles. Your palate will also be satisfied with special meals of fresh seasonal ingredients based on nutrition science. During this program you will be given great tips about bike riding from a mechanical viewpoint on riding safely and from a nutritional perspective. Besides exercising on two wheels is the most healthy and active way to spend your leisure time, so join Niki Ride and have fun! ●Available from May 1st to Nov 30th in 2016 *Please contact us at least one month before your preferred start date. We will make a schedule with “Nasu Blasen”. *In addition, let us know a second choice of date, because the tour is likely to be affected by weather conditions. ●Access to Niki Club Nearest Station is JR Nasu-Shiobara Station. It takes 75 minutes ride of Tohoku Shinkansen Line from JR Tokyo Station *They operate a shuttle bus service 3 times a day from JR Nasu-Shiobara Station. If you request a pick-up service, let us know one day prior to your arrival date. ●Shuttle Bus Service Timetable From Nasu-Shiobara Station to hotel: 12:30 / 14:30 / 16:30
strTitle: Enjoy Wellness Program & Cycling Scenic Nasu Roads, Tochigi!

strIntroduction: In this unique activity you can visit a local Japanese farm near Tokyo and experience the daily life of farmers! Join the farmers in their rural activities and enjoy a delicious healthy lunch with fresh and seasonal ingredients! Date: Every weekday. Departure Location: TABICA's office in Harajuku Activity place: Depends on the date. Contents: 10:00 Meetup at the office 10:15-11:15 Head to the destination and meet the host. 11:30-14:00 Activity Time! (includes lunch) *We will cook lunch using seasonal vegetables from the farm (potatoes, zucchini, cabbage, etc.) 14:00- Head back to the office and finish the tour Duration: 10:00-15:00 Things to bring: ・clothes suitable for farming activities ・something to drink (no alcohol) ・hat or cap Minimum number of participants: 2 people
strTitle: Visit a local farm near Tokyo and have fresh lunch!

strIntroduction: Book this shared airport transfer service to or from the Kansai International Airport to many area in Osaka! This shared shuttle bus service will pick you up at Kansai International Airport and drop you off the designated hotels or drop off address in Osaka area. This service can also be used to transfer to the Kansai International Airport. You just have to inform us the hotels or the address where you want us to pick you up. This shared shuttle bus will wait for your arrival from 45 to 80 minutes after the EAT (estimated arrival time). It will also wait for your arrival even if the flight is delayed. This private transportation will take you to the designated drop off area as you show up at the airport. This shared shuttle bus will pick you up at the designated hotels or address and take you to the airport immediately, so you can arrive 100 – 180 minutes before your departure time (60 – 90 minutes for domestic flight). The total of luggage per person is 1 (one) big suitcase per person. If you have many luggage, please inform us in advance. You will also be charged for an extra fee for you luggage. Transferring from the Kansai International Airport to Osaka City by train is not easy if you carry many big luggage. We suggest you to use this shared shuttle bus service as one of your travel supports. In addition, if you use our reservation service, you can book this transfer service easily with no hassles!
strTitle: Shared Shuttle between Osaka/Kansai International Airport!

strIntroduction: Reserve this program and enjoy touring around Miyazaki prefecture for 6 hours with private cars! This is the ideal shore excursion for cruise passengers coming to Miyazaki and travelers who wish to explore more of the area! This tour program you a half-day trip around Miyazaki with private transportation service with the following itinerary: - Departing from Miyazaki city - Visit Aoshima Island Aoshima Island, is a small and beautiful island located in the south of Miyazaki city. Aoshima is connected to the mainland by a bridge, surrounded by white beaches and subtropical jungle. You can walk around the Aoshima's beaches and enjoy shopping souvenirs there. You can also visit the Aoshima Jinja, a colorful shrine set back in the jungle that is believed to bring luck to married couples. - Visit Horikiri-toge Pass Enjoy the astonishing view of the Nichinan-kaigan coastline and the Hyuga-nada Sea from Horikiri-toge Pass. The pass is enhanced with the shift of the Poinsettias, that turns red from mid October to mid November. Don't forget to see the rugged bedrock called "Demon's washboard" beneath the pass! - Visit Sunmesse Nichinan Sunmesse Nichinan is a theme park located in Miyazaki prefecture. This park has a wonderful wide panorama of the Pacific ocean and full replica of the Eastern Island Moai Statues scattered around. This replica is the only Moai statues replica in the world. You can also enjoy many interesting dining facilities and guests ranceh at Sumesse Nichinan - Visit Udo Shrine Udo Shrine, is a shrine dedicated to Yamasachihiko, the father of Emperor Jimmu, the mythical first emperor of Japan. The shrine is located on the Nichinan Coast, south of Miyazaki city. You can enjoy the spectacular view of the ocean from the cliff of this brightly painted shrine. - Visit Miyazaki Shrine Miyazaki Shrine is the oldest and the most important shrine in Miyazaki city. This shrine is dedicated to Emperor Jimmu, the mythical first emperor in Japan, which is said to have been built over 2600 years ago. - Visit Heiwadai Park Heiwadai Park, or also known as the Peace Tower Park, is the most recognized landmark in Miyazaki. It was built in 1940 to celebrate the 2600th anniversary of the ascension of Emperor Jimmu, the mythical first emperor of Japan. The Peace Tower inside the park is built by stones sent from all around Asia. - Arrive in Miyazaki city This half-day tour program is accompanied by an English speaking private tour guide, so you don’t have to worry about the language barrier. Use our reservation service and enjoy this tour to the fullest with your friends or family!
strTitle: Shore Excursion Around Miyazaki Prefecture for 6 Hours!

strIntroduction: SHINKA, a hair salon originally from Sydney, Australia, launched its international branch at Roppongi in 2012, offering each customer the "New Beauty". SHINKA is a global hair salon offering top notch services, which branches are located near many foreign embassies and five-star hotels. SHINKA's highly experienced hair stylist can give you new style that suits you the best, while you are enjoying the relaxing atmosphere of our studio. SHINKA has been nominated for Best Design in beauty magazines, for its spacious and comforting studio. The Australian brick work of the building provides warm calming sensation, and the grand fish tank containing over 100 tropical fish soothes your mood. At SHINKA, you can enjoy relaxing on SHINKA's special shampoo chair while having your hair washed with our organic shampoo and conditioner. SHINKA also serves you drinks during waiting time or after the head spa. SHINKA's special cappuccino and hot chocolate are very popular among the customers. Don't forget to try SHINKA's most popular menu, the "Water Color". Different from the average hair coloring products, "Water Color" contains higher level of moisture, which gives your hair the glossy finish after coloring. It also gives your scalp less irritation and it is not as smelly as the other hair coloring products. SHINKA also offers you 10-days after care service. If you do not like the style or if you have any problems related to the service that SHINKA has given, you can return and ask them to fix it within 10 days. SHINKA provides hair care and hair styling service with schedule as follows: Monday to Friday 11:00 - 20:30 Saturday /Public Holidays 10:30 - 18:30 Close on Sunday and on the 2nd and 4th Monday. Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our service too book this hair salon with no hassles!
strTitle: Tokyo Hair Salon: Hair Care Service at SHINKA in Roppongi!

Nail Quick offers gel nails and polish colorings with beautiful nail arts applied by highly-trained experts. Enjoy the extraordinary level of service and quality art of the nail salon in Tokyo by making a reservation for one of the following courses: - Nail parfait gel special art course for 10 nails (hands) - Nail parfait gel one colour course for 10 nails (feet) - Calger clear gel course with glitter art for 10 nails (hands) - Calrget foot course for 10 nails (feet)
strTitle: 15% OFF Best Tokyo nail salon "Nail Quick" Reservation

strIntroduction: After a meeting at Sensoji Temple in Asakusa, we'll look for some extremely impressive but barely noticed scars of the firebombing at the end of WW2 right on the grounds of the temple. We'll head North and stop at Imado Shrine, a must-stop for the lonely souls in search of love, and one of the self-proclaimed origins of the Maneki Neko. We will stroll through Yoshiwara, the district of pleasures during Edo times. Nowadays, the neighborhood is still punctuated with borderline brothels and "soaplands" (for the avoidance of doubt: there will be no visit of any of those establishments). Our tour will bring you through San'ya, where the poorest of the poor daily workers lived in a near-ghetto, site of a few (very) dark anecdotes, slum in the background of the manga "Ashita no Joe". We'll finish in Kozukappara, site of the execution grounds in Edo, where tens of thousands lost their lives in feudal times. This tour will bring us through some less-flashy, sometimes even gloomy, parts of the capital. We may use public transportation from time to time (in which case we will try to use public city buses to remain on the surface). The schedule is adjustable depending on your wishes.
strTitle: See the area beyond Sensoji: half-day tour north of Asakusa

strIntroduction: For those who lack time, discover in a day the major districts and attractions of the Eastern side of the capital on a private tour. We will start near Shinbashi Station and the splendid Hamarikyu gardens, a little bit of the old Edo amongst shiny high-rise buildings. Next stop will be Ginza, we will stroll through the back-alleys of the most known shopping area in Japan. After a quick stop near the Imperial Palace, we will head towards Akihabara and its multitudes of shops for the geeks that we all are. We will then continue towards Ueno through the open-air market of Ameyayokocho. We will finish the day by visiting the most famous temple of Tokyo, Sensoji Temple in Asakusa. We will use public transportation between each stops, and discover the city on foot, but a car can be arranged upon request. The itinerary is somewhat flexible and can be modified to accommodate your wishes.
strTitle: Discover the essentials of Tokyo's eastern side, 1-day tour

strIntroduction: After meeting at your accommodation, we will head to Shibamata area in Katsushika ward. The busy temple of Taishakuten and the many shops lining the pilgrimage path offers a very authentic slice of traditional Tokyo. The neighborhood is also the setting of the extremely prolific movie series (almost 50 installments!) "Otoko wa Tsurai yo", several spots here remind the visitors of its protagonist, Torasan. The visitor can cross the Edogawa river on the last ferry of the city, Yagiri no Watashi. We will then head to Mizumoto, the largest park of Tokyo, seldom visited by tourists, and discover a few off-the-beaten path attractions.
strTitle: Stroll around Shibamata area in Tokyo, half day tour

strIntroduction: Meet at your accommodation and transfer to the dynamic district of Ikebukuro. Stroll the Otome Road and shop in Sunshine City. Next stop will be Shin-Okubo and its lively Korean district. From there, we'll walk to Shinjuku and discover both sides of the station: the Western side and its high-rise buildings (we will go up the Metropolitan Government Office building, offering a fantastic viewpoint on the city), and the Eastern side where all come, play and shop. Transferring to Harajuku, we'll visit the famous Meiji Jingu Shrine, make a brief stop in Yoyogi park, and stroll down Takeshita Street. Walking the fashionable cat street, we'll reach Shibuya, its crowds and its neon lights towards the end of the afternoon. We will use public transportation between each stops, and discover the city on foot, but a car can be arranged upon request. The itinerary is somewhat flexible and can be modified to accommodate your wishes.
strTitle: Discover the essentials of Tokyo's western side, 1-day tour

strIntroduction: After an early start from the Ryutsu Center Station, we will directly head to the vegetable section, followed by the flower section, to observe the busiest auctions of these products in the country. We will walk through the gigantic warehouses of the (currently) largest wholesale market of Tokyo, occupying an overall area larger than the worldwide known Tsukiji. We will of course have a look at the seafood section. With some luck, we might have a good view of Mount Fuji from the parking area of the market. Slightly off-the-beaten path of usual touristic destinations in Tokyo, this market has very few outside visitors, allowing to watch first hand the spectacle of the auctions.
strTitle: Enjoy a private tour of the large Ota Market in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Join the drinking parties of our group in Tokyo! We split the members into small groups and then you talk with some people while sitting on a chair. After a while, some people move to new seats. This enables you to make many friends in Tokyo. We also do some activities. For example, origami (the art of making objects for decoration by folding sheets of paper), Japanese calligraphy for making kanji names for non-Japanese members. If you want to try, please tell during the session. Near future schedule: Please ask me!!
strTitle: Join a drinking session with locals in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Discover how to cut fish like a Japanese pro during this unique culinary class in Tokyo’s Tsukiji district, known for its fish market. Under the guidance of an instructor, you’ll learn how to cut up a whole fish (high quality and freshly caught) to be eaten as sashimi. Afterward, eat what you’ve prepared! ◎Highlights -Tokyo fish-cutting class in the Tsukiji district -Learn the proper technique for cutting up a whole fish from the beginning -Eat your sashimi when you're finished -Enjoy the taste of freshly caught fish such as mackerel or bonito ◎What You Can Expect Once you come to the designated venue, you can get ready for an authentic and professional experience. First you will learn how to cut and recognize a high-quality fish. You will cut various different types of fish, varying by the seasons. You will cut for example two Aji (horse mackerel), one medium-sized seasonal fish (Inada, bonito, etc.). Once you cut your fish, following your instructor´s guidance, you can take it home and eat as sashimi. -Departure time Every Tuesday and Thursday - 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM / 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM -Duration 60 minutes
strTitle: Enjoy Fish-Cutting Lesson with Sashimi Instructor in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: Take advantage of unique photo ops at Tsukiji Market while dressed in either a Japanese "yukata" (light kimono) or wearing kabuki makeup — or both! After donning this traditional costume, an informative guide leads you on a walk past numerous stalls at the world’s largest fish market. ◎Highlights -Tsukiji Market tour in traditional dress -Choose to wear kabuki makeup and/or yukata -Stroll through the market for fantastic photo ops! -Learn about Japanese traditions from a professional guide ◎What You Can Expect Enjoy Tsukiji! This tour includes walking around the largest fish market in the world, Tsukiji, Tokyo! You will have the option of wearing Kabuki makeup, a Traditional Japanese Yukata or both! Then you will be shown the Tsukiji area, then be free to eat lunch at a location of your choosing. Here is the tour: - Kabuki makeup You will arrive at our office and our staff will put Kabuki Makeup on you. It's an interesting process. - Put on Yukata You will then be assisted in putting the Yukata on. It's not simple clothes so getting assistance is definitely helpful. - Tour Tsukiji You will then explore the Tsukiji market. It's about 4 rows of back to back fish related stalls that make up the market and all are interesting. You are free at this time to also eat lunch at any of the locations in Tsukiji. Depending on how the tour goes you may also wish to see Ginza which is also near by. You will then return and remove makeup and Yukata. - Departure time 10 am-10 pm -Duration Yukata Rental 15 min/per person fitting time Return by 10:00 pm Kabuki make up 20 min/per person makeup application Return by 10:00 pm
strTitle: Tour Tsukiji Fish Market in Kabuki Makeup!

strIntroduction: In this activity you can practice making decorative sushi as a form of Japanese culinary art! Meet at the ticket gate of Kami-Otai Station around 10 am on Monday. We'll walk to Fumie's house together. The schedule is as follows: 10:00 - 12:00: making decoration sushi rolls 12:00 - 12:30: eating time 12:30: Send you off to the station. There are 9 kinds of decorated sushi rolls (Snail, Sea Otter, Pink flower, Snoopy, Totoro, Bird, Octopus, Bear, Minions). You can choose making one of them.
strTitle: Experience Making Pretty Decorated Sushi in Nagoya

strIntroduction: After a pick-up at your accommodation, we will head towards lively Oji in Kita Ward. We will stroll in Asukayama park, the oldest park of the city established simultaneously with Ueno, and talk about the history of the surroundings. Heading West, we will look for relics of a gigantic war factory complex near the Shakujii River, with a few intact pieces and buildings here and there. We'll head towards Itabashi, the first stop on the Nakasendo road during Edo times, and discover about its fascinating history, while taking a look at a few temples and shrines along the way. Continuing our way, we will make a brief stop in Tokiwadai, a planned residential neighborhood of the first half of the 20th century, with a few buildings still standing. We will switch periods and explore a bit the mammoth residential complexes near Akabane Station, representative of the early postwar urban development of Tokyo. After some strolling near Akabane, the gateway to the North, we will end the day at the Iwabuchi sluice, a magnificent piece of engineering dating from Taisho times, and see the starting point of the Arakawa canal. This is a full day walk, roughly 16-17 km, relatively flat, passing through seldom visited areas of Tokyo.
strTitle: Dig deeper in the Northwest of Tokyo: 1 day local area walk

strIntroduction: You can learn how to cook takoyaki (Osaka's famous food) and eat them at one of the izakaya bars on Sennichimae Doguyasuji shopping arcade in Osaka. Doguyasuji shopping arcade supplies all the kitchen needs to this culinary obsessed city. Many tourists also stroll these streets in search of the perfect souvenir to take home from their trip to Osaka. Detail of the workshop: •please come to shop at the meeting time •staff will explain how to cook •cook takoyaki (staff will instruct you) •eating •cook more takoyaki •eating •end of the workshop You can cook takoyaki dumplings twice in this activity. Both kids and adults can enjoy this workshop. Timetable: First session: 10:00 am-11:30 am Second session: 12:00 pm (noon) - 1:30 pm Third session: 2:00 pm -3:30 pm If you want, we provide beer, sake, shochu (we charge for alcohol).
strTitle: Experience making Takoyaki in Namba, Osaka!

strIntroduction: Lake Motosuko is one of the Mt. Fuji Five Lakes that have long been considered sacred for the Japanese people. Its astounding beautiful landscapes of crystal clear waters and the iconic Mt. Fuji in the background are even depicted on the back of the 1,000 yen bill. Lake Motosuko is special in that it has the clearest and deepest water of all the Five Lakes, which has made it hugely popular among people who like water sports. One of the best ways to explore the area is to go on a canoe trip on the lake and paddle your way through the amazing landscapes. In this activity you will have half a day to explore the lake at your leisure and enjoy not only the beautiful landscape, but the sun on your skin, the wind and the natural sounds of the lake. Besides the canoe rental fee, the activity includes gloves, paddles, and a life jacket for you to enjoy feeling safe. Depending on the season, enjoy the beautiful and unique landscapes of each period of the year and plan a whole day at the lake, with several restaurants and hotels around so you can plan one of the most memorable days of your trip to Japan.
strTitle: Enjoy views of Mt. Fuji from a canoe in Lake Motosuko

strIntroduction: Get on a mountain bike and ride downhill through the beautiful forests near Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi. In this activity, you will be able to experience the thrill of mountain cycling while you enjoy the breathtaking beauty of the nature of the forest around you, catching glimpses of majestic Mt. Fuji as you make your way down, and stopping in amazing sightseeing spots that you can't usually access by foot. You will be accompanied by an experienced and qualified instructor, who will explain all the safety measures you will need to know to have a safe experience. Besides, they are trained in first aid response, so that you can ride confidently knowing that you are in good hands, even if you are beginner. The activity includes the rental of the mountain bike, as well as helmet, gloves and instructor fee, so all you need to do is bring comfortable clothing and shoes and be ready for an amazing experience that will become a highlight of your trip to Japan. Alternately, there is a Mt. Fuji cultural heritage guided cycling tour that will take you around Lake Kawaguchi and to Fuji Omurosengen Shrine and Kawaguchi Asama Shrine, where the guide will provide detailed information about the sites. Don't miss the chance to experience this unique way of exploring the nature near Mt. Fuji by bicycle.
strTitle: Explore the nature around Mt. Fuji on a mountain bike!

strIntroduction: Whether you love adventure and thrilling experiences, or are simply looking to explore the Mt. Fuji area in a different, unique way, the buggy car experience in the forest near Lake Kawaguchi is perfect for you. Ride your own all terrain four wheel buggy car and make your way through narrow dirt roads and slopes that will take you deep into the forests, where you will be able to have fun exploring in the car while admiring nature, catching glimpses of majestic Mt. Fuji. Alternately, you can also ride an 8 wheel buggy car driven by an instructor to enjoy with your kids. You can enjoy this experience even if you are a beginner and have never ridden a Buggy car, because the qualified instructors will teach you all you need to know about the operation of the buggy car and assist you to ensure that you have a fun and safe experience, additionally, they are trained in first aid response, so you can be confident that you are in good hands. Furthermore, both buggy cars and paths undergo maintenance periodically to ensure they are in optimum shape. For more experience riders, there are also a number of routes with steeper slopes that are more challenging, as well as a night time experience. Don't miss the chance to experience the beautiful surroundings of Mt. Fuji with breathtaking landscapes that change according to the seasons, offering you a unique view in each time of the year, all while enjoying the thrill of riding a buggy car.
strTitle: Explore the forests near Mt. Fuji in a buggy car!

strIntroduction: One of most iconic views of Mt- Fuji has to be the mountain reflected on the surface of Lake Kawaguchi, and what better way to admire it as well as enjoying the beautiful, natural surroundings of the lake than by hoping on an authentic Canadian canoe and spending two hours paddling on the lake. There are three ways you can experience this activity. Canadian canoe experience: You will join a small group accompanied by a qualified and experienced instructor, trained in First Aid response who will assist and guide you throughout the activity, making it easy to learn and providing a safe experience even for beginners, and people of all ages. Canoeing solo: Alternately, if you are experienced in canoeing, or have completed the Canadian canoe experience, you can take on the challenge of canoeing by yourself, while still benefiting from the instructor's knowledge and guidance, by paddling solo, you will have more freedom to explore and enjoy the lake at your pace. Canoe guided cruise: Finally, if what you are most interested in is the view and the pleasant trip on the lake, you can also join this activity where the guide will paddle and provide commentary about the area as you sit and relax while taking in the natural landscape. This activity is available for up to two people. Note that you will not paddle the canoe in this option. No matter your preferred style, this is a unique way to experience the area and enjoy nature. The activity is available all year round, with each season offering a unique landscape for you to enjoy. Also if weather permits it, you can step on the inhabited island in the middle of the lake known as the 'island of the cormorant', an aquatic bird native to the area. Don't miss the chance to reconnect with nature and enjoy that beautiful landscape of Mt. Fuji reflected on the lake as you actually paddle on it, in company of your family, friends or that special someone.
strTitle: Enjoy lake Kawaguchi in a Canadian canoe near Mt. Fuji!

strIntroduction: Visit Aomori and join the Nebuta Festival only with this tour program! Nebuta Festival is one of the Three Greats Festivals of Tohoku Region. The Nebuta Festival is a breathtaking and unique celebration event in Aomori, which is held once a year from August 2 to 7. It features gorgeous, vivid floats shaped after famous historical and mythological Japanese characters. Nebuta Festival is the most colorful festival in Japan. Nebuta Festival is the most memorable and visually impressive festivals in Japan. Nebuta Festival is a gem of Aomori prefecture, and because of this, many locals in Aomori will spend their entire year constructing the enormous Nebuta floats. The floats are made by fragile Japanese paper and handcrafted wire and bamboo frames. Most floats typically depict Japanese Gods, historical figures, kabuki actors, and mythological beings. Hundreds of light bulbs are weaved throughout the floats, illuminating the parade with amazing colors. Therefore, by day the Nebuta floats are impressive, but by night they are absolutely breathtaking. The best part of this festival actually is not the floats, nor the performers. The best part of this festival is the fact that the audience can participate in the festival too. The audience can dance around the floats and chanting “rassera” a nonsensical Japanese phrase only seen during the Nebuta Festival. Nebuta Festival is also a competition of the floats. Each year the best floats are chosen, and on the last night of Nebuta Festival, the top three floats are transported to ships in Aomori harbor to cruise along the bay. You can also enjoy the festival food, haunting flute music, and dancing at the festival. This tour program offers you two days round trip shinkansen tickets departing from Tokyo and an overnight accommodation at hotels in Aomori city. Spectator seats tickets are not included in this program, so you will need to buy it directly on site if you want to seat in that area. Reservation is difficult to make, so we recommend you to use our service to book with no hassles! IMPORTANT: *This trip is available in Japanese only* - however we highly recommend this as a rare Japan experience that you can enjoy regardless of language.

strIntroduction: Visit Akita City and join the Akita Kanto Festival with this tour program! Akita Kanto Festival is one of the Three Great Festivals of Tohoku Region. Akita Kanto Festival is a Tanabata related celebration in Akita City, which is held every year from August 3 to 6. The highlights of the festivals are the impressive performance of the Sashi-Te (male performers who lift up the kanto’s long bamboo poles with arrays of paper lanterns) and the Ohayashi (performers who play taiko drums and Japanese flutes). The kanto poles come in different sizes with the largest measuring 12 meters, weighing 50 kilograms and carrying as many as 46 paper lanterns, lit by real candles. The performers change every few minutes and gradually add extensions to the pole until the kanto reach its maximum heights. The Kanto Festival is also a form of prayer to the Gods, aiming for good and powerful harvests of the rice. This tour program offers you two days round-trip Shinkansen tickets with overnight accommodations in Akita city. Spectator seats tickets are not included in this program, so you will need to buy it directly on site if you want to seat in that area. Reservation is difficult to make, so we recommend you to use our service to book with no hassles! IMPORTANT: *This trip is available in Japanese only* - however we highly recommend this as a rare Japan experience that you can enjoy regardless of language.
strTitle: Visit Akita and Join the Akita Kanto Festival!

During the festival, you can see over 10,000 taiko drummers and dancers parade through the city, which makes this festival listed in the Guinness Book of Records as the largest taiko drum festival in the world. strIntroduction: This is a day trip that lets you experience one of the major traditional cultural events in Japan, The Soma Nomaoi Festival. The festival is celebrated across all the former Soma Domain territories (2 cities, 4 towns, 1 village) in Soma and Futaba counties with Minamisoma City being the main venue. This three day festival, held every year on the end of July, is a reenactment of the pomp and splendor in the warring state period with 500 mounted horsemen in traditional samurai armor participating. Soma-Nomaoi is said to be one of the greatest equestrian festivals in the world. The festival features a race with twelve Samurai horsemen, with helmets, armor and katana swords racing in a 1,000 meter course, as well as a battle of hundreds of Samurai horsemen who fight over sacred flags shot into the air by canons, as well as many more breathtaking ceremonies and events. This is a unique festival in the world that you cannot miss!
strTitle: Experience the Soma-Nomaoi Samurai horsemen race, Fukushima!

strIntroduction: Washi is a traditional Japanese paper with more than 1300 years of history. It is made with the gampi tree, the mitsumata shrub or the paper mulberry, but also can be made using bamboo, hemp, rice, and wheat. It is often used in traditional arts such as origami, shodo calligraphy, ukiyo-e paintings and even everyday articles such as clothing, household goods and ceremonial clothes and objects for shinto priests and Buddhist statues. It was designated by UNESCO as an intangible cultural heritage object. In this activity you will visit Washi-no-Sato paper-making facility in Higashichichibu Village in Saitama prefecture, where you will learn about the history and tradition of washi and even have the opportunity to make your own postcard out of washi paper. This is a guided activity, where the guide will explain the process step by step. First, participants skim off the paper material from the water tank under the supervision of the instructor. Even if you think this is hard work, you will be surprised to realize that in fact, it does not require much physical labor, and even women and children can participate without any trouble. When the pieces of paper, skimmed off in the shape of postcards, are put on a table, participants create their desired designs on the postcards using the juice squeezed from garden flowers and plants, as no artificial ink is used. After the participants put their favorite designs on the postcards, the staff will put a thin layer of Japanese paper over them to finish the entire work. The participants can have their finished postcards within one to two hours. This is a creative, relaxing activity that will fully occupy your mind and make it seem like time flies. The facilities also exhibit Hosokawa-gami (local specialty paper) as well as tools for the production of Japanese paper inside a 300-year old house. Visit this beautiful and relaxing place and learn about the history and tradition of Japanese paper making!
strTitle: Experience the old tradition of Washi paper making, Saitama

strIntroduction: It's summer time, the season of festivals! This tour allows you to experience the famous festival in Aichi, the Toyohama Sea Bream Festival. It's also known as one of the most unique festivals in the world. It's said that the festival started around 1890, when a carpenter created the float in a shape of a mouse to make their festival exciting. In the beginning, the shapes of the float were animals. After time had passed by, the shape transformed into sea creatures. Since the area is famous for the fishing industry, it's natural to have the float with the theme of sea creatures. In the beginning of the Taisho period, people created sea bream shaped floats. In the beginning of the Showa period, a float had people inside, playing a drum, a flute and a shamisen (Japanese traditional three-stringed instrument). People carried the float and walked throughout the town, and even went to the ocean. This style of the festival remains true today. The completed float weighs one ton and requires about 60 people to carry it. We're certain that you'll be blown away by the festival. A tour guide will take you from Nagoya to Toyohama, so you can relax and enjoy the ride. The tour is operated in the afternoon on July 23rd and 24th. Details of the schedule need to be confirmed.
strTitle: Explore Toyohama Sea Bream Festival, in Aichi!

The hotel is facing Ago Bay at Ise Shima national park and the beautiful architectural buildings are surrounded by the richly greened garden where you can walk and pick some herbs. The food at the restaurants in the hotel is mainly seafood from the bay and the sea nearby together with local seasonal ingredients. With this plan you can either choose French seafood or Japanese kaiseki (Tea ceremony dishes). Both restaurants have huge windows facing the bay, so you can enjoy the sunset at dinner time. The highlight of this hotel package is its spa treatment. “eau spa by Clarins” is the first resort Spa in Japan. Clarins is one of the most popular skin care brands in Europe and all treatments are done by hand with Clarins products. At first, you will make a booking for your treatment. The treatment begins with a counseling by a therapist. The treatment will be discussed and decided depending on your condition on the day. Starting with a foot bath you will then have an aroma massage treatment. Your legs, back and shoulders will be softened by the therapist’s hands with aroma oil! After the treatment, you can relax with herbal tea and the therapist will give you some advice for simple treatments at home. Then you can just relax in your room until dinner time or you might want to go for a stroll to feel the new freshness of your body. *Check-in:15:00 / Check-out:12:00 Option 1 Stay at the hotel with Spa treatment for 60 minutes. *2 meals are included. *5/17/2016-9/30/2016
strTitle: Book a room at resort hotel with Spa treatment in Mie!

strIntroduction: This tour is a two-hour cruise that provides you with not only traditional Japanese food, but also Chinese and Western food. A reservation can be hard to make at the busiest times, such as Cherry Blossom Season or the New Year. The departure time is between 12:00-20:00, however, it is also possible to start at other times, please feel free to contact us. The most famous tourist spots on this tour are Nakanoshima and Dōtonbori with a variety of events being held all year around. Options: 1. Standard tour 2. Extension (per hour) Attention: 1. The tour can provide three types of boat, it depends on the amount of guests or you can request the boat you like. 2. This is a two-hour plan including all-you-can-drink, you can even bring your own food or drink. 3. You can choose from Chinese, Japanese or Western food for your course. 4. This tour starts at a minimum of 12 people and maximum of 22. 5. To make sure of your reservation, you need to pay in advance during the first week after your booking. Boats: 1. The Gondola Bar boat This is the largest boat of all three and is capable of carrying up to 22 people. 2. The Good Memories boat This boat can only carry 11 people and it is the most suitable boat for Cherry-blossom viewing. 3. The Osaka Party Cruise boat This boat can carry 10 people maximum.
strTitle: Reservation for Meal and Yakata Boat the Gondola Bar, Osaka

strIntroduction: Hapuna is a place where you can relax and enjoy a foot bath, massage or aromatherapy massage. The aromatherapy massage is one of the most popular treatments in Hapuna. This is a calm, slow and relaxing full-body massage using tender movements and warm aromatic oils that spoil both your body and soul. Hapuna also serves drinks during your massage. Option 1: 30-minute massage + 10-minute footh bath (1 drink included) Option 2: 60-minute massage + 10-minute footh bath (1 drink included) Option 3: 30-minute aromatherapy massage + 10-minute footh bath (1 drink included) Option 4: 60-minute aromatherapy massage + 10-minute footh bath (1 drink included) Attentions: 1. Only one drink is included in the package. Refill will be charged 300 JPY for beverages and 400 JPY for beers. 2. Extension of footbath is available. Every 30 minutes for 200 JPY. 3. Please wipe your feet with paper towel before and after the footbath. 4. You can rend short pants for 100 JPY as massage dressing.
strTitle: Reservation for Foot Bath & Massage at Hapuna, Shinjuku

Built in 1989 next to a cliff around 40 meters high, it has two signature holes, 7 ponds and creeks and beautiful tropical plants making it a beautiful place. Here are the details of this link: Kind: Seaside Difference of elevation: Flat Area: 0.9km² Green: 1 Hole: 18 holes and 72 pars Course: out and in Option 1: An overnight stay at weekdays Option 2: An overnight stay at weekends Option 3: An overnight stay at weekends with caddies Attention: 1. strIntroduction: Sayama, rich in natural beauty, is one of the three highest quality tea producing regions in Japan which also is the nearest tea planting area to Tokyo (located in Saitama prefecture). This hands-on experience of hand-rolled tea making is also available. Inside the souvenir store, you can buy the freshest tea. This tour starts with a lecture about tea processing and the skills of picking tea leaves, then you can pick leaves by yourselves before tasting a Japanese cuisine made with tea leaves. Other optional services are also available. For example, you can try on the traditional tea-picking clothing or you can learn how to pick and pack tea leaves in a container by yourself. Please ask the staff for more information if you intend to book these optional services. In addition, you can book hotel pick-up as an additional option. However, please note that transportation is not included. Attention: This tour only operates during early May to mid-October.
strTitle: Experience the Wonder of Picking Tea at Miyano-en, Sayama

strIntroduction: Halal foods and drinks are those permissible for Muslims to eat or drink under Islamic law and is a strictly defined way to eat and prepare food. Halal sushi for example requires the fish must be live right before being sliced for sushi. In addition, Japanese necessities such as seasonings like soy sauce or mirin are not used. In Tokyo, Halal food is only available in certificated Halal restaurants. Preparing such food is difficult and this Halal sushi making experience in a Muslim karaoke bar is a fun experience where you can enjoy halal food and singing at the same time! Staff from "Halal Recipe Japan" provide the sushi recipe accepted by Halal restrictions following easy-to-understand instructions. Then, while enjoying your freshly made sushi, you can have fun singing karaoke too. There are more than 200,000 up-to-date songs available for you to choose from. Malay and English speaking staff are always present, making it easier and more comfortable for you to enjoy the experience.
strTitle: Make Halal Sushi at Muslim-Friendly Karaoke Bar in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Fasting is the greatest remedy for your body to heal itself recovery its energy. On this program a counselor will set a schedule during your stay, suitable to your body condition. You will be given a liquid nutrient made from a variety of fruits, vegetables and lactic acid bacteria making your fasting less stressful. Plus, you will be given important tips to keep a healthy lifestyle at home. At Amamu there is a yoga studio, pool, jacuzzi, and a big bathhouse. Optional programs for beauty-treatment, horse-riding, and special yoga sessions are available with additional charges. Don’t miss the chance to cleanse your body at Amamu! ●Sample Itinerary DAY 1 14:00-16:00 Check in -Orientation Counselor will ask about your condition and life habit, then propose the schedule during your stay. -Free Time! -Soak in a big hot bath, read books at a library, walk around the hotel, and get a massage at a beauty salon and join a special yoga session. -22:00 Sleep DAY 2 -7:00 – 7:45 Morning yoga (free) -Free Time! -22:00 Sleep DAY 3 -7:00 – 7:45 Morning yoga -8:00 Breakfast! -You will be served light food that is easy to digest, and advise how you eat after breaking your fast. -9:00 – 10:00 Check out ●Access Pick up at 14:30 or 16:50 at JR Takahagi Station (About 100 minutes ride on the express train "Super Hitachi" from Ueno to Takahagi Station) *If you need a pick-up service, let us know when making your reservation. ●Optional Activities Horse riding: 2,000 – 15,000JPY (*Price will change depending on the class and your level.) Morning yoga class: Free Special yoga session: 2,000 JPY Segway: 2,000 JPY- Cart riding: Free Pool: Free Spa treatment: 4,000 JPY-
strTitle: Reset Your Body & Soul by Fasting at Amamu, Ibaraki!

strIntroduction: Enjoy a luxurious time sleeping on a high rebound mattress which makes you feel as if you are lying on a cloud enjoying the breathtaking view from a guest room located approximately 100 to 140 meters above ground? This experience includes the sky resort spa “Plau Blan” on the 22nd floor. A breakfast service is also available at a restaurant where you can enjoy a great view of Sapporo. Airweave is the top selling mattress topper in Japan and is well known for supporting the World Cup and Olympics. The sky resort spa with natural hot spring water comes from the underground source below Sapporo Station offering you a healing, relaxing wonderful, urban city of Sapporo scenery from the window 100 m above ground. Enjoy the comfortable sky resort spa that makes you forget about time passing, spoil yourself. The guest room furniture is well arranged allowing you to enjoy the great scenery from the wide window. Stretch yourself out on the airweave and fall asleep while watching the night view for a quality moment! Enjoy a perfect night’s sleep that will recharge you and bring you the energy for next day. Try the experience of the high rebound mattress topper that is 90% air and polyethylene fibers entwined in 3D and dissipates body pressure evenly reducing physical strain and also preventing a build-up of heat and dampness. The outstanding breathability provides for a comfortable sleep even when perspiring.
strTitle: Enjoy a Sky Spa & Sleep on an Airweave Mattress in Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Hurry up and don't miss your chance! This tour runs for only a limited time from July 23 to August 21! This bus tour from Sapporo takes you to the famous sightseeing spots in the area such as the sunflower field in Hokuryu Town, beautiful scenic hills in Biei, Asahikawa's Snow Museum and Farm Tomita. A farmer started planting sunflowers in Hokuryu Town over 35 years ago and every time the field was damaged by typhoons and tornadoes, people in the town united together to save the field. This beautiful sunflower field filled with townspeople's love, will make surely delight you. Biei area is characterized as the scenic hills and you can enjoy the fantastic scenery from your bus window and see the famous Patchwork Road. The Snow Museum in Asahikawa is a masterpiece of architecture. The entire building resembles a medieval castle and you will discover many wonderful ice decorations inside. Farm Tomita offers you a gorgeous lavender field. Relax and appreciate the aroma of lavender. After recharging your energy, a lavender ice cream awaits you to complete your experience. Here is the tour itinerary. 8:15 am Departure from JR Sapporo Station's bus terminal. Itinerary: -Sunflower Field in Hokuryu Town (50 minutes) -Snow Museum (40 minutes) - lunch at Altimall Higashi Kagura Restaurant OMP (1 hour and 5 minutes) -Biei Patchwork Road (from the bus window) -Farm Tomita (free time) 18:45 pm The tour ends at JR Sapporo Station. The tour is operated daily between July 23 and August 21. ---Notes--- ・If the tour participants are under 30 people, the tour will not be operated. ・Depending on weather and road conditions, the tour itinerary may be delayed and changed. ・If the sunflowers are not in bloom during the tour operation period, the tour schedule may be changed and the tour may have an alternative destination. ・Tour is free for child below 6 years old if the child does not require a seat. If the child below 6 years old requires a seat, please book the (child, 6-11 years) option
strTitle: Enjoy a 1 Day Tour to a Sunflower Field and Farm, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Wellness Hotel with farm, “Fufu Yamanashi” is a unique facility where guests can forget about the labors of every day’s life and focus on a healthy lifestyle and it is operated by medical specialists cooperating with local farmers to provide the best setting for good sleep, excise, healthy diet, and relaxation. There are various interesting programs such as a walking in the woods program which includes bathing in the morning sun to reset your biological clock. Morning yoga will remind you of the benefits of a workout and deepening your breath. “Karada Reset Program” or body reset program is helpful for having great posture and enhancing your inner muscles. In addition, there is a program to experience farming! Guests can help with cultivation or picking vegetables, providing a rare chance if you are a city dweller. In addition, healthy meals are served, called “therapy food” using seasonal ingredients, especially vegetables in a French full-course style. Guests can eat plenty of vegetables, do some moderate exercise, and commune with nature in a beautiful environment! There is no better place for unwinding than this. Spend your holiday at Fufu Yamanashi! ●Room Fufu Yamanashi has Japanese-style rooms with tatami and futons as well as Western-style rooms with beds. Every room is equipped with a bathtub and shower, but you can try an open air Jacuzzi to immerse yourself in its luxury! ●Optional Menu Fufu Yamanashi prepares optional programs such as “therapy walking in the woods,” “trekking Mt. Konara,” “aroma treatment,” “art therapy” and “examination of autonomic nerve balance”. You can join each program for an additional fee. Trekking Mt. Konara needs an advance reservation. ●Price includes: 5 set programs/ Meals/ Amenities ●Access Pick up at 11:30 or 14:00 at JR Enzan Station of Chuo Main Line (About 90 minutes by express train "Azusa" or "Kaiji" from Shinjuku to Shioyama Station )
strTitle: Relax at Wellness Hotel with Farm, Fufu Yamanashi!

strIntroduction: The Port of Kobe is a famous tourist spot in Kobe. This tour is a two-hour cruise tour that provides you with traditional Japanese food like Monjayaki or Yakiniku. When people think of Japanese food, most think of sushi. However, you probably don't know, but another of Japan’s popular dishes is something called Monjayaki. Monjayaki is simple but complicated! It has just a few simple ingredients and can be made in under three minutes. However, it requires detailed instructions to make. Details of this tour: 1. Departure will be from the No.4 station of Kamomeria at the Port of Kobe. 2. Kobe Port Tower can be seen from the start. 3. It takes about 10 minutes to get to the Hyougounga. 4. The meal is served after the arrival of the Hyougounga. 5. You can also enjoy a lot of other tourist spots from the boat. 6. The meal ends 15 minutes before the return. Options: 1. A buffet of Monjayaki (adult) 2. A buffet of Monjayaki (child) (age 3-12) 3. Yakiniku with one drink (adult) 4. Yakiniku with one drink (child) (age 3-12) 5. Wagyu with one drink (adult) 6. Wagyu with one drink (child) (age 3-12) Attention: 1. The whole tour is around 2 hours and starts three times a day. Morning: 11:00-13:00 Afternoon: 15:00-17:00 Evening: 18:00-20:00 2.Last order is 40 minutes before return. 3.The price includes the ticket and meal. 4.You can also enjoy an all-you-can-drink for 90 minutes by adding 2,000 JPY for each person. 5. Minimum 2 people booking in advance. 6. This tour starts at a minimum of 10 peopleT
strTitle: Try Monjayaki or Yakiniku on a Yakata Boat in Kobe

strIntroduction: Enjoy the famous Shower Climbing tour in Tokyo! Shower Climbing in Japan is called "Sawa-Nobori". Enjoy the natural water slider and the enormous waterfall! You can definitely refresh yourself! This is a great outdoor experience in the mountains west of Tokyo! Choose between the full day option and the half day option: Full Day Option: The full day option includes both Shower Climbing and ducky. Each activity lasts 3 hours. The first activity will be in the morning between 9:00-12:00, and the second activity will be in the afternoon between 13:00-16:15. If you request a BBQ, it will start after 4 pm. Please do not worry, you can buy lunch at the venue. Half Day Option: The half day option includes 3 hours of Shower Climbing. You may choose to do the activity in the morning between 9:00-12:00 or the afternoon between 13:00-16:15. Optional Add-on: You can enjoy a BBQ after your activity! The BBQ option is available under following schedule: Monday-Thursday: after the morning half day tour only. Friday-Sunday & public holidays: after the full day and afternoon half day option only. Please note: Children (from 6 years old) and those who can't swim are welcome! Life jackets and helmets will be provided. You can rent shoes for 200 JPY at the facility. Check out our exciting “White Water Rafting Tour” too! https://www.govoyagin.com/activities/japan-tokyo-rafting-tour-on-tama-river/1003
strTitle: Enjoy Shower Climbing Tour on Tama River

Anzu is rich in vitamins A and minerals, and it is a superfood for your digestive systems. It promotes better and healthier digestive systems and it is also rejuvenates your body from fatigue. strIntroduction: The unique feature of Hayato Salons is that the majority of the staff is bilingual, having been trained in either NY or London. The stylists at Hayato Salons are experts in managing foreigners’ hair types. Only the stylists who undergo our academy's 48-course stylist training program, developed for over 20 years by Hayato, fulfill a set number of practical training on models determined by our salon, and meet the criteria set by the directors, debut as Hayato Salons' stylists. We are not just particular about the quality of our services, but also about our creative techniques. For a maximum relaxation for the customers, we developed our own method of secondary shampoo, in addition to the standard shampooing technique. We, believe that “people become beautiful when the inner and outer beauty harmonize”. Increasing number of Japanese women, like Western women, are becoming more independent. With more women receiving higher levels of education and entering the workforce, many of them are assuming high-power positions similarly to men. As such, many women are under a great stress. New York, London, Roppongi, Harajuku, Omotesando and Hakone are where Hayato Salons are located. We aim to offer services beyond what customers expect from a typical hair salon and have many customers who have enjoyed their time throughout the world.
strTitle: Experience hair salon with Omotenashi, Hayato Tokyo
