With more women receiving higher levels of education and entering the workforce, many of them are assuming high-power positions similarly to men. As such, many women are under a great stress. New York, London, Roppongi, Harajuku, Omotesando and Hakone are where Hayato Salons are located. We aim to offer services beyond what customers expect from a typical hair salon and have many customers who have enjoyed their time throughout the world.
strTitle: Experience high-quality hair salon, Hayato Tokyo

strIntroduction: We run the historical road tour of Kokufu-cho by bicycles. We will pray at several temples included in the 88 temple pilgrimate of Shikoku. In addition, we will visit a Shinto shrine. Kokufu-cho was a state's capital in the ancient times. There are many remains showing that the place prospered. Ancient buildings are reproduced in the park. We will visit the park and will feel the atmosphere of the ancient times. There is also a pond with springing water. Let's spend a happy time in Kokufu-cho, Tokushima, by cycling!
strTitle: Enjoy cycling tour of the historical town Kokufu, Tokushima!

strIntroduction: You can appreciate the masterpieces of the world art at the unique Otsuka Museum of Art in Tokushima, Shikoku. More than 1,000 masterpieces are exhibited on a magnificent scale. The world's first ceramic plate paintings are reproduced in ceramic boards of the original full size. Not only masterpiece paintings, but also the entire Sistine Chapel Ceiling is reproduced! Picasso's son and the staff of international museums of art have visited this place and have praised the museum and its works. Audio guide players are available in four languages: Japanese, English, Chinese and Korean. You can listen to 6 commentaries on time periods and about 100 commentaries on paintings. To see all the paintings of 1,000, you must walk a route of about 2.5 miles!
strTitle: Visit the unique Otsuka Museum of Art in Shikoku

strIntroduction: We will meet at Shuri monorail station, and then go to the workshop. It takes about a 15-20 minute drive from Shuri monorail station to the workshop. In the workshop, many items from famous local artists are on display and can be purchased. Sayoko Kinjo, who has a 15-year career in Okinawa as a Bingata artist, will teach all the classes. Many of her works are displayed in hotels in Okinawa. During this tour, you will have the chance to make an original bingata tote bag. The time required for this workshop is about 4 hours. *This tour can start at any time from 9:30 to 13:30 (Monday to Saturday) *The maximum allowed for each group is six people. *Please contact us for availability.
strTitle: Enjoy Traditional Bingata (Okinawan Dyeing) Experience, Naha

strIntroduction: We'll meet at Shuri monorail station in Naha, then we will go to the karate museum. It takes about 20-30 minute by car from Shuri monorail station to karate museum. The museum is on the second floor of a karate dojo. You can see many old photographs and old karate items on display. The curator is a famous calligraphy teacher whose calligraphy is sold at a high price in a shop near the Shuri Castle. Only here customers can buy calligraphy works at a special price! You can order your favorite word written on wood or paper by calligraphy. After that, I will take you back to Shuri monorail station. The time required for this tour is about 2 hours. This tour runs between 10:00 and 16:00 (on Tuesdays and Saturdays: 10:00 to 15:00). Let's enjoy a wonderful time together at the traditional karate museum while learning more about Okinawa's history!
strTitle: Visit a Karate Museum in Okinawa

strIntroduction: This is 3 hour tour at Asakusa, Tokyo. Asakusa is one of the best traditional sightseeing places in Tokyo. You'll feel the old Japanese culture at this place. It's very popular and we will take a commemorative photo during this tour. I'll pick you up at Asakusa Station (if you need me to pick you up from your hotel, please contact me). First, we will go to the Kaminarimon gate and take a commemorative photo in front of the big gate. After that it's shopping and eating time at Nakamise street. Try some of Japanese snacks and buy souvenirs. Free time for around 40 minutes. Then, we will see Asakusa Temple which brings luck to visitors. Also I will introduce local spots at Asakusa. You will see some awesome places such as "appa bridge tool street". If you want to see other place at Asakusa, please tell me. I'll take you if we have a time. At the end of the tour, I'llg ive you a commemorative photo and a small gift. Duration: 3 hours Participants: 2-8 Day of the week: Tuesday, Thursday, Friday Meeting point: Asakusa Station (if you need me to pick you up from your hotel, please contact me) Pick up time: anytime is OK! (please tell me when you book) I'm looking forward to seeing you in this tour!
strTitle: Enjoy an amazing Asakusa walking private tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is the ultimate outdoor experience in rural Japan! Book this exciting 2-day camping and fishing tour in Yamagata's picturesque mountains! Time Schedule: Day 1 10:00 pick you up at Yamagata Station 11:00 Arrive at the foot of the mountain, start trekking 12:00 Lunch in the forest 13:30 Fishing 15:00 Pitch a tent 16:00 Cook dinner 18:00 Drink a tea or beer 20:00 Go to bed Day 2 5:00 Wake up 5:30 Harvest wild vegetables in the forest 6:30 Cook breakfast 7:30 Relaxing fishing time until 9:00 9:30 Leave riverside 11:00 Back to the foot of the mountain and end of tour ※ Please inform us what time your train arrives at Yamagata Station in advance.
strTitle: 2-day Camping and Fishing Experience in Yamagata's Mountains

strIntroduction: The day will consist of a tour around the World Heritage, the sacred Mt. Fuji, shopping at Gotemba Premium Outlets, the largest outlet shopping center in Japan and a visit to a hot spring with a panoramic view. We will pick you up at your accommodation and depart at 8:30 am. Course-1 (morning): The tour will start from one of the most stunning view points of Mt. Fuji famous for its five-storied pagoda at Arakurasengen Park. We will move to see the pastoral landscape of Oshino Hakkai with old style Japanese houses and a total of eight ponds formed from the beautiful groundwater of Mt. Fuji. The name “Hakkai” meaning eight seas actually represents the ponds that were originally used for cold showering for the pilgrims in the Edo era. We will be taking lunch at a local restaurant. Course-2 (morning): The tour will start form the 5th Station of Mt. Fuji - the most popular and easiest starting point for climbing. You will see the enormous mountain from its 2300-meter high view point. If the weather condition is good enough you will see the sea of clouds. We will have lunch at Tokimekino Fuji restaurant that offers a variety of local meals using organic foodstuff that are cultivated on their own. Afternoon: We will move to Gotemba Premium Outlets, the main event of the day - the largest outlet shopping center of japan. You will have free time for shopping for about 2 hours and 45 minutes. The day will end in at a hot spring with a panoramic view of Mt. Fuji. Important notice: Due to road closures for private cars at the 5th station between July 11th to August 31th and from December up to the end of heavy snow season, we will offer alternative plans such as visiting shrines, walks around Lake Kawaguchi, visiting the ice caves, activities at the Ninja Village or other options you wish to request. We can customize the course to suit your needs.
strTitle: Visit Fuji Gotemba Premium Outlet and relax in a hot spring

strIntroduction: The day will consist of a tour around the World Heritage, the sacred Mt. Fuji. You will discover not only the beauty of the mountain, known as a source of art, but also visit places where pilgrims stopped over during the Edo period (17-19th century) before their pilgrimage to the divine mountain. The first eruption of Mt. Fuji started about 100 thousand years ago. It then took 90 thousand years to form its symmetric shape and become the highest mountain of Japan reaching 3776 meters or 12388 feet - our symbolic mountain. As a characteristic of stratovolcano, its beautiful symmetrical shape has inspired lots of artists and foreign visitors over the past centuries. It is recorded that the earliest pilgrimage to Mt. Fuji started around the 8th century. In the middle of the 14th century, during the Sengoku period (Japanese Warring States period), Kakugyo became the patriarch for the pilgrimage we know today. This folk religion spread rapidly as the country was in an unstable state. It was then followed and revised in the next 400 years. After the death of Kakugyo, people from all over the country formed groups or clans to make their pilgrimage preserving the following beliefs: 1. Doing good will bring you good, if you do bad then things will turn bad 2. If you work you earn and become rich, stay away from disease and have a long life 3. If you are lazy you will be poor, sick and live a short life This tour is not just a sightseeing but is designed to have a more diverse perspective by discovering history, culture, religion and values of the people that are all related to Mt. Fuji. The course will end at a hot spring which is a typical way of relaxing and communicating at the end of the day. Important notice: Due to road closures for private cars at the 5th station between July 11th to August 31th and from December up to the end of heavy snow season, we will offer alternative plans such as visiting shrines, walks around Lake Kawaguchi, visiting the ice caves, activities at the Ninja Village or other options you wish to request. We can customize the course to suit your needs.
strTitle: Beautiful views of Mt. Fuji and worship history with onsen

strIntroduction: Enjoy the cultural and natural experiences of Yamagata prefecture in an exciting 3-day tour! A mountain guide will take you to some of the highlights of the area! I'll pick you up and start the tour. 13:30 Ginzan Onsen hot spring town 17:00 Check in the lodge 18:00 Dinner Day 2 7:30 Breakfast 9:00 Mt. Gassan trekking 12:00 Lunch at the mountain 15:00 Japanese tea ceremony experience 18:00 Dinner Day 3 7:30 Breakfast 11:00 Soba making experience 13:00 Yamadera Temple visit 15:00 Take you to Tendo Station 18:00 Arrive at Tokyo Station (Shinkansen not included in the tour price) This tour is held for a minimum of 2 people and a maximum of 14 people. strTitle: Experience Yamagata's Nature & Culture in a 3-day tour

strIntroduction: Iya Valley is a mountainous valley in western Tokushima prefecture. Located deep in the moutains and surrounded by steep slopes and deep rocky gorges with swinging bridges, Iya Valley is a perfect hideaway for people who seek relaxation as well as outdoor activities in the wild of nature. Take a ride on Dosan Trolley from Okayama, the classic cable cars will slowly lead you through all the best spots for you to enjoy the scenic views along the way. Since the place is well-known for its hot spring, the tour will first arrive at Shiniya Onsen. Take your time to soak in the local hot bath and have a taste of Iya cuisine with a kaiseki meal. Then walk across the Iya Kazurabashi Bridge and enjoy the view of green water below as well as the panoramic mountainous view all around. Next get on the Oboke Gorge Sightseeing Boat and row along the water to enjoy the beauty of nature. -Notes Please note that the fare to cross the Kazurabashi Bridge is not included in the tour. You will be required to pay entrance fee of 500 JPY on site. And the 490 JPY boat fare for children age 3-5 needs to be paid separately on site.
strTitle: Excite Yourself on a Relaxing Vacation to Explore Iya Valley
